Module com.example.sudoku
Package com.example.sudoku.model

Class Sudoku

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudoku.model.Sudoku
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Sudoku extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a Sudoku game model. This class encapsulates the logic for managing a Sudoku grid, solving the puzzle, validating moves, and generating a game board with random elements or fixed distributions.

This class implements the Sudoku logic with methods to initialize the grid, check the validity of moves, and provide solutions to the puzzle.

The class also handles generating random Sudoku boards and checking if the user's moves are correct.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sudoku

      public Sudoku(int size, int block_height, int block_width, boolean useFixedDistribution)
      Initializes a Sudoku board with a given size, block height, block width, and a flag to determine whether to use a fixed distribution or generate random elements.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the Sudoku board (e.g., 6 for a 6x6 grid).
      block_height - The height of the blocks in the Sudoku grid.
      block_width - The width of the blocks in the Sudoku grid.
      useFixedDistribution - Flag indicating whether to use a fixed distribution of elements or generate them randomly.

  • Method Details

    • solve

      public boolean solve()
      Solves the Sudoku puzzle using a backtracking algorithm.
      Returns:
      true if the puzzle is solved; false if no solution exists.

    • copy_original_board_into_temp

      public void copy_original_board_into_temp()
      Copies the original board into the temporary board to allow solving.

    • print_board

      public void print_board(String option)
      Prints the board for debugging purposes.
      Parameters:
      option - The option to print either the original or the temporary board.

    • play

      public void play()
      Starts the game loop where the player makes moves to fill the Sudoku grid.
